comments.text: I usually got a ride here in less than 2 minutes. Has enough space for cars to pull down, simply perfect! [AdrianB] -HUNGAROHITCH for prez!
This is a really good place for hitching down south towards the coast. Had to wait about 10-15 minutes. I would walk onto the highway ramp to catch as many cars as possible.

Didn't wait at all, the first Icelandic car I waved down stopped :D

Hitching in Iceland in October was unbelievably easy - the first day I got 7 rides east on the Ring Road and didn't wait once over 5 minutes. Icelanders pick up so much and so fast. They told me in the summer it gets really crowded with hitch-hikers and they often don't have space, so I was apparently lucking out on hitching in the fall :) Was a bit chilly and dark to camp out though.

Hitching up to Höfn couldn't be easier, th

If you are heading south using the road no. 1 towards Selfoss then this is the place where to wait in Reykjavik.

There is a big Olís gas station nearby (before the roundabout) but I prefer to wait after the roundabout - cars are passing by slowly and it's not so busy place. But it depends on your preferences - both possibilities are great.

You can walk there or get there by bus no. 19 or 5 (station Helluvað).
The best place to hitchhike from Akureyri towards East. Stand a few metres away from the place where cars are leaving the petrol station.
There's a cool place to pull over next to the gas station, there were two of us hitchhiking there and it didn't take long to get a ride even with almost no traffic
Wide space to pull over right after the gas station. You may see airplanes taking off if you are lucky.
really great spot, not to much space for stay but cars ride slowly and its possible to take you fast
Depends on the days of the week but a really good spot generally

Got dropped off by my first ride from Hvollsvöllur here at the car park for Seljalandsfoss. Went around to ask cars leaving for a lift to Skogarfoss and literally the first car i asked was happy to take me there. Super friendly tourists - a couple from Costa Rica
Super easy. Stood on the grass verge next to the N1 gas station in Hvolsvöllur. Was headed towards Skogar and was given a lift by a friendly czech couple to Seljalandsfoss
Great spot
A good spot.
super cool spot
Best spot in direction to Kirk and the east coast.
This was my first hitch ever. First time I put out my thumb the first car that passed me kicked me up. He was a semi-pro Icelandic footballer
The only car to pass me all day passed by, then put it in reverse ~200m to pick me up. Cute old couple going to the hospital.
Locals are helpful, traffic wasn't too busy but after 5 minutes I got a ride

Single lane road but with a biiiggg hard shoulder. Traffic slowed by bridge good visibility, had a sign saying airport, ride in 5 minutes at 8pm. Thank you Iceland!! 2 minute walk away from the number 1 bus from Iceland centre (~500kr cash, the driver said, "whatever you have"
Cool spot to get a ride towards Selfoss/Reykjavik
Good spot. A lot of traffic. Even though the cars are going relatively fast, they can see you and will stop. There is even space for pulling over.
Good spot. You can get here by bus from Reykjavik
good spot

This is the best place for hitchhiking if you're leaving the ReykjavÃ­k area to the north. Cars are slowed down here right after the roundabout and they have space to stop on the shoulder to pick you up.

The BEST spot, 5 min walk from airport, slow traffic, good visibility, tons of space to pull over in a shoulder and lay by. Used thumb, no asking needed, ride to Reykjavik in 2 mins! Driver spoke English, damn that was easy!!
A lot of space for cars. I spend 3 minutes here.
Good spot. Safety. You can catch cars on both sides. behind the station and right off the road, because there is a large, wide side.
Waiting here next to the gas station might be better than the spot a bit further down. There is a lot of space. I have hitched here many times.
Still working spot. Cars are going uphill and you have a chance to catch something. There's a wide, safe side path.
Got a ride all the way to Selfoss
Actually the best way to get out of Vík. Just go to the city-limit sign, where also the weather-information table is. Good place for stopping.
I recommend to walk 500m backwards, there is a nice and loooong bus stop, so cars can stop easily! ;]  [AdrianB]
Excellent for hitchhiking toward Akranes
The best spot to leave Akureyri to North/Northwest/West, it takes a little bit to walk to this spot, but it is absolutely recommended.

Good place to stand. The road is a bit wider after the junction so cars can stop. Also gas station is nearby in case you need to buy something or get shelter. I stood there with a sign saying Reykjavík for two hours between 17.30 and 19.30 in summer. Noone stopped. Stood there without a sign the next morning. Got a ride to Rvk within 30 minutes. HI Hostel is 10 minutes down the road past the Bónus store in case you need to crash somewhere.
A kind tourist picked the two of us up, and we continued our journey together along the south coast before heading back to Reykjavík. Bónus is no longer on the corner.
I wait a little further down the road before the "70" sign, there is a bit more space for them to stop.
Had to hitchhike in Selfoss, because our rental car broke down. It was easy, even with 3 people, we had a ride to Reykjavik after 5 minutes.

Good place at the end of the town to hitch-hike towards Hella and Vík. 

It's not the "top 10" place because there's not a lot of space to stop safely and a lot of cars are turning right to the supermarket just in front of you but if somebody wants to take you he will definitely stop here. Cars go still quite slowly.

Btw. There's a cheap supermarket "Bónus" just next to this hitch-hiking spot.

Not the best spot in the world but the there is quite a lot of cars and they go slowly because of the roundabout. We had to wait for an hour but we got a ride all the way to Reykjavík, our friends got a ride in a few minutes, depends ;)
Not a bad spot but in April, there weren't many cars going clockwise, after about an hour I managed to get a ride all the way to Akureyri.

Good spot in direction to RVK and KEF. Here ejst a popular turn to the black beach next to reynisfjara, as if here would beoc iut not ok, then a piece further on is a small aprking on the right side in the direction of RVK.
Good. You don't find anything better than this spot.
Some space to pull over after a speed bump
Good spot, a lot of traffic but still some space to pull over.
Good spot for heading north. The cars are going fast but they see you from a far away and there is plenty space to pull over. You can even ask people around on the parking lot but it’s not that busy.
Just before this spot there is a platform for crossing the street so the cars are going relatively slowly and there is nice spot where they can pull over. It’s a good place for heading north.
The place is as well great for watching the wales in the fjord(summer). Traffic gets pretty low in the late evening.
Started walking towards the next crossroads and hitched at the same time.
It can be quite windy at that spot. Supermarket and toilets nearby. Going north for a few 100m will give you some nice camping  options.

We were 2 people hitchiking from that spot, in general I think it's a good location. It's on the main ring road and there is a parking just in front  of the spot. I wouldn't recommend to anyone hitchhiking there in the winter because there is nothing near by , so if you end up waiting there for more than an hour it can be dangerous.

This is very good spot to hitchhike, you have cars coming from 2 different directions and most of them are heading to Akureyri, we were 2 people and only waited 10 minutes to get a ride, also there is a minirmarket just next to it,
There's a good spot to pull over if you're going clockwise and most cars go to Dettifoss, maybe a bit further

Dont remember waiting time. But i got a ride from there all the way to Reykjavik. With a restaurant a jacuzzi and an appartement in Vik  for the night. My best hitchike experience ever. With two car full of friendly Pakistan.
Westward from Skaftafell. In the summer many cars will come out from the park's access road.

Was trying to get a lift towards Selfoss or Reykjavik was hopeless as cars were approaching too fast to possibly stop and cars turning out from Skogarfoss were totally uninterested in stopping. Had to give up when it started getting dark and thus dangerous to be stood by the side of the road. Had to camp the night at Skogafoss. Would not reccomend this spot.
Waited 20 minutes because of another hitchhiking couple. After they gave up it tooks 2 minutes to get a ride.
There's a spot where the ring road meets the road to the Skogafoss waterfall. There are a lot of tourists heading here so it's good to go in the directions of Vik or Borganes.
Cars coming from both sides so some traffic in a otherwise isolated place.
Thumbing the traffic coming from patreksfjord. Got a long distance ride towards Reykjavik. Quiet road, limited space to pull over but it worked. Drivers spoke good English. Near the shipwreck

VERY DANGEROUS!!!
DONT GO HERE. ITS A HIGHWAY NOW
As the guy above, i waited 1min while actually was just walking with thumb out. Now i also have 4h until my flight...
Took me 12 minutes.
I got a ride to the airport within seconds, I didn't even have the chance to put my backpack down. IT was so quick I ended up with 4:30 hours to kill until my flight...

There aren't really any good spots here, but Bus number 1 from Reykjavik stops very near by (When you reach HafnarfjÃ¶rÃ°ur, just ask the driver to let you know when you're close to Reykjanesbraut) and you'll kind of have to walk along the road with your finger out. The road shoulder is not bad though, so cars can stop if they see you in time. Not good, but it works.
